Characteristics: The symptoms of Spi. m. are mainly from overdosing. A state of mania was induced in a boy from large and frequent doses of a decoction of the root. Strabismus of right eye was noted in one case.
Mind: Suddenly affected with complete mental derangement, exactly like that of Stram., countenance distorted, running and skipping, fits of laughing and crying, pupils greatly dilated, talk wild and incoherent, (lasted 24h.).
Head: Vertigo.
Eyes: Irregular movement of adductors and abductors of eyes.
Pain in and about the eyes.
Face: Much swelling of face and about eyes.
Generalities: On attempting to assume erect position, seized with general tremor lasting a few seconds and leaving her exhausted.
